item.title: new claims for unemployment benefits rise; wholesale inflation up
item.description: more people applied for unemployment benefits last week, the first increase in three weeks.

item.title: new rules to let europe web users turn off cookies
item.description: people surfing european websites will be able to turn off the cookies used to spy on their internet habits under rules hammered out by the region's online advertisers, an industry body said on thursday.

item.title: smokers show higher risk of leg artery disease
item.description: women who smoke are much more likely than non-smokers to develop clogged arteries in the legs -- but quitting can lower those odds, according to a study published monday.

item.title: netflix cuts data use on canada online service
item.description: online video rental company netflix inc has tweaked its canadian streaming service to cut down on the amount of data it uses in a country where internet usage is typically metered and capped.

item.title: nevada regulators back caesars' internet gambling gambit
item.description: nevada regulators have approved the first marketing agreement between a las vegas hotel and casino company and an overseas internet gambling concern, a move welcomed by advocates for legalized online gambling in the united states.

item.title: assault in border town sends syrians into lebanon
item.description: an attack in tall kalakh killed at least three in the latest phase of a government crackdown.

item.title: special report: the nuclear industry's trillion dollar question
item.description: in the inbox of petr zavodsky, director of nuclear power plant construction at czech power group cez are three sets of proposals from american, french and russian consortiums, all angling for a $30 billion contract to build five new reactors.

item.title: clearwire signs network deal with ericsson
item.description: clearwire corp has chosen ericsson to take over management of its high-speed wireless network to help it cut costs, the service provider said on wednesday.

item.title: u.s. seeks lehman details, creditors mull own plan
item.description: a u.s. official who oversees bankruptcies is seeking information about alternative plans to reorganize lehman brothers holdings inc and pay roughly $60 billion to the bank's creditors.

item.title: art review: a muse in the machine: click. create.
item.description: cory arcangel's 'pro tools' show at the whitney contains mainly works from 2011 and barely any taste of his funkier early digital efforts, or artistic development.

item.title: ibaka's double-double helps thunder to 3-0 series lead
item.description: transforming from a shot-blocker into a shot-maker, serge ibaka tied his career high with 22 points and sparked the oklahoma city thunder's 97-94 ...

item.title: drilling down: one log-in catches on for many sites
item.description: according to a new report, in the first quarter of 2011, facebook overtook google as the leading social log-in site.

item.title: corrected:trial of white man accused of black church fire begins
item.description: a pastor testified on monday in the federal trial of a white man accused of torching his mostly black church to protest barack obama's election as the nation's first black president.

item.title: sands, not lights, cover gaza archaeology sites
item.description: five thousand years of fascinating history lie beneath the sands of the gaza strip, from blinded biblical hero samson to british general allenby.

item.title: islamist militant leads prayers for bin laden in pakistan
item.description: the founder of one of pakistan's most violent islamist militant groups has told muslims to be heartened by the death of osama bin laden, as his "martyrdom" would not go in vain, a spokesman for the group said on tuesday.

item.title: lawsuit against police officer in killing of pace athlete
item.description: the family of a pace university football player killed by police during a late night bar fight filed a $120 million lawsuit on wednesday against the officer who fatally shot him.

item.title: palmer takes early control at nelson as winds strengthen
item.description: local favorite ryan palmer, who has benefited from a more selfish approach to the game this season, charged into a four-shot lead early in friday's second round of the byron nelson championship in irving, texas.

item.title: explosion hits police station in northeast nigeria
item.description: an explosion hit a police station in nigeria's northeastern city of maiduguri just as presidential elections were beginning saturday, the second blast in the past 24 hours, residents said.

item.title: imam, son in u.s. court over pakistani taliban charges
item.description: a 76-year-old florida imam and his son were ordered on monday to appear next week in a u.s. federal court where they face charges of providing support for the pakistani taliban.

item.title: chris brown outburst divides fans, album soars
item.description: singer chris brown angrily stormed out of a tv studio on tuesday, reigniting controversy over his 2009 assault on singer rihanna but helping to send his new album to the top of itunes charts.

item.title: community health raises all-cash offer for tenet
item.description: community health systems has raised its all-cash offer for rival hospital operator tenet healthcare by 21% to about $3.52 billion, but it said ...

item.title: chris brown sorry for outburst, album heads to no.1
item.description: ramp;b singer chris brown apologized for throwing a tantrum over renewed questions about his assault on ex-girlfriend rihanna, but said he felt exploited and "wanted to release the anger inside me."

item.title: "gma" invites chris brown back after outburst
item.description: "good morning america" has invited chris brown back to the show -- even though he stormed off their tv set tuesday, threw a cooler and allegedly broke a window because he was so angry about being asked about rihanna.

item.title: nadal holds on to no. 1, djokovic wins again in rome
item.description: rafael nadal will keep the no. 1 ranking for at least another week following an efficient 6-1, 6-3 win over croatia's marin cilic in the italian ...

item.title: in 'homefront,' war gets up close and personal
item.description: north korea invades the usa in a new video game developed by one of the men behind apocalypse now and red dawn.

item.title: the problem with the f.d.i.c.'s powers
item.description: the f.d.i.c.'s power to deal with failing major banks is curtailed by its need to have the treasury as a cooperative partner, an economist writes.

item.title: anchorage: moving to the city, but clinging to native ways
item.description: census results from alaska reveal that many native alaskans and american indians are leaving small villages for larger cities like anchorage.

item.title: 2 are killed in sixth nato copter crash since late april in afghanistan
item.description: two nato service members died when their helicopter crashed in eastern afghanistan sunday, the latest in a string of crashes in recent weeks that remain under investigation.

item.title: diet plan with hormone has fans and skeptics
item.description: a new trend in dieting has women injecting themselves with a pregnancy hormone and consuming only 500 calories a day.

item.title: luongo looks to change his playoff history
item.description: canucks goalie roberto luongo has a checkered playoff history. but in game 1 against the blackhawks, he was unstoppable.

item.title: stoudemire is doubtful for game 4
item.description: stoudemire, who said he played friday at less than 50 percent, is reluctant to risk further injury to his strained lower back.

item.title: southeast: wisconsin 72, belmont 58: wisconsin's long-range game grounds belmont
item.description: wisconsin brought its offense out of the deep freeze into the desert, and the thaw was remarkable.

item.title: poisoned web: a girl's nude photo, and altered lives
item.description: law enforcement officials and educators are struggling with how to confront minors who 'sext.'

item.title: patient infected with aids virus by transplant
item.description: health officials are reporting that a patient was infected with the aids virus through a kidney transplant from a live donor.

item.title: 'bengal tiger' burns bright on stage
item.description: the horrors of war are handled with a humanizing touch, thanks to robin williams.

item.title: rights group accuses ugandan police of torture and killings
item.description: a report by the group human rights watch outlined a series of accusations against the rapid response unit.

item.title: south carolina grows more urban
item.description: south carolina's population swelled 15.3% in the past decade to rank among the nation's 10 fastest growing states, u.s. census data show.

item.title: new york woman sentenced to two years for animal abuse
item.description: a new york woman who admitted mistreating her children and torturing and killing dozens of pets, some in front of the youngsters, was sentenced to two years in prison on wednesday.

item.title: at#38;t launches its first prepaid smartphone
item.description: atamp;#38;t has revealed details on its first prepaid smartphone, which will hit stores on april 17.

item.title: u.s. companies in libya uncertain about prospects
item.description: the u.s. oil companies and other firms with libyan operations have been unable to get much solid info about the business impact of the revol ...

item.title: north carolina city honors black civil war soldiers
item.description: hundreds of african-american union soldiers buried in the national cemetery in wilmington, north carolina, after the civil war were honored thursday with a state highway historical marker.

item.title: new entrepreneurs on the rise in socialist cuba
item.description: the salvation of socialism in cuba is taking some odd turns, with words like "competition," "marketing" and "opportunity" being heard for the first time in decades on the communist-led island.

item.title: square feet: after legal war, a west side landmark may rise
item.description: the metro theater on manhattan's upper west side has gone through several incarnations since 1933 and may become home to an arts education group.

item.title: fighting spreads in yemen, raising fear of civil war
item.description: government troops waged increasingly bloody street battles with opposition tribesmen for control of crucial areas in the capital.

item.title: he can hit shots, but must wait for one
item.description: jorge vazquez is a home run hitter powerful enough to play in the big leagues, but too limited defensively to become the yankees' backup infielder.

item.title: woman mauled to death by pit bulls in new mexico
item.description: a woman has been mauled to death by a pack of four pit bulls in the town of truth or consequences, new mexico, authorities said on monday.

item.title: a greater incentive for whistle-blowers
item.description: the s.e.c.'s new rules give corporate employees a reason to bypass internal compliance programs and report directly to the government in the hope of reaping a financial windfall.

item.title: buyer emerges for the dallas stars
item.description: tom gaglardi, a businessman from vancouver, british columbia, is expected to pay about $250 million for the team and half of the lease to its arena.

item.title: friday shuttle launch drawing sky-high interest
item.description: injured rep. gabrielle giffords will watch her husband blast off.

item.title: arab league delays summit by year to march 2012
item.description: a summit of arab leaders has been postponed by a year to march 2012 because of turmoil in the region, but will still be held in iraq as originally planned, the arab league said on thursday.

item.title: downloadable content can be yours, temporarily, at the library
item.description: more libraries are making electronic books and audiobooks available for use in an array of mobile devices, from "readers" such as the nook to ...

item.title: nfl plunged into crisis as labor talks collapse
item.description: america's most popular sport was plunged into crisis as negotiations between the nfl and the player's union collapsed on friday, triggering instant legal action from the biggest names in the sport that threatens to disrupt next season and cost billions of dollars.

item.title: sweat: off the major deegan, the everyman golf pro
item.description: paul sliva, tutor at the van cortlandt municipal course, has a direct teaching style that has endeared him to players like andrew giuliani.

item.title: lockout looming after union talks break down
item.description: the nfl was on the verge of its first work stoppage in almost a quarter of a century when negotiations over a new labor deal collapsed on friday.

item.title: ex-mets employee charged in theft
item.description: the former mets clubhouse manager charlie samuels, 53, was charged wednesday in connection with the theft of nearly $2.3 million in team equipment and memorabilia.

item.title: pakistan pays u.s. lobbyists to deny it helped bin laden
item.description: pakistan's washington lobbyists have launched an intense campaign on capitol hill to counter accusations that islamabad was complicit in giving refuge to osama bin laden.

item.title: bin laden death boosts obama, fears of attack: polls
item.description: president barack obama's job approval rating jumped 11 points to 57 percent after the killing of al qaeda leader osama bin laden in pakistan, but americans fear another attack, polls showed on wednesday.

item.title: toshiba in discussions to buy landis gyr
item.description: after a competitive bidding process, toshiba has emerged as the sole potential buyer for landis gyr, a swiss smart-metering company, in a deal that could be worth more than $2 billion.

item.title: libyan no-fly zone extending to tripoli
item.description: coalition warplanes attacked libya on monday, but on a smaller scale than the weekend assault that led to the no-fly zone, officials said.

item.title: policies cover tornado damage, but coverage may fall short
item.description: if a tornado blows your house down, you may not have enough insurance to pay for rebuilding. many homeowners don't.

item.title: on baseball: managing at the intersection of then and now
item.description: joe girardi and brian cashman must tread carefully these days, navigating sentiment and high expectations with a roster that includes several aging yankees icons.

item.title: will.i.am returning to "idol" to perform "rio" song
item.description: just two weeks after performing with the black eyed peas on "american idol," will.i.am will return to the top-rated fox tv show to perform his song from the 20th century fox animated film, "rio."

item.title: ford widens recall by 1.2 million trucks
item.description: under pressure from the national highway traffic safety administration, ford has agreed to recall an additional 1.2 million pickup trucks because the driver's air bag may inadvertently deploy.

item.title: lakers 87, hornets 78: lakers grind past hornets, even playoff series
item.description: kobe bryant barely made a ripple on offense for the los angeles lakers. he was too busy ensuring chris paul didn't make another huge splash that could have put the lakers in a cavernous playoff hole.

item.title: higher gas prices pinch consumers
item.description: with gas prices up more than a $1 a gallon in the past year, consumers are cutting costs elsewhere

item.title: new england: massachusetts: conviction in racially motivated fire
item.description: a white man has been convicted in what prosecutors say was the racially motivated burning of a black church after the election of president obama.

item.title: germany says al qaeda suspects planned bomb attack
item.description: three suspected al qaeda members had been planning a bomb attack in germany for four months when they were arrested, federal prosecutors said.

item.title: stricker survives a barrage of birdies by his competitors to win the memorial
item.description: steve stricker staved off seven birdies in eight holes by brandt jobe and six birdies in eight holes by matt kuchar to win the memorial tournament.

item.title: wholesale inventories up, sales fall
item.description: u.s. wholesale inventories rose in february, but sales unexpectedly fell to post their largest decline in nearly two years, a government report showed on friday.

item.title: harry david files for bankruptcy
item.description: the maker of fruit-filled gift baskets files for chapter 11 in delaware to cut down about $198 million in bond debt.

item.title: u.s. hispanic growth outstrips census estimates: study
item.description: growth of the u.s. hispanic population is so fast and dynamic that it has outstripped estimates by the u.s. census bureau, according to a study released on tuesday.

item.title: robert de niro testifies in new york larceny trial
item.description: oscar winning actor robert de niro told a packed manhattan courtroom on friday he had never received payment from an art gallery director on trial for allegedly pocketing the proceeds of three paintings by his late father, robert de niro sr.

item.title: analysis: ti-natsemi deal vaults analog back into limelight
item.description: analog chips are back in fashion after texas instruments inc hatched a $6.5 billion deal to buy national semiconductor corp as it looks to cement its place in the mobile computing explosion.

item.title: oracle jumps as outlook points to market share gains
item.description: shares of oracle corp rose 5 percent on friday, a day after the world's third-largest software maker forecast solid sales of new business software, signaling strength against...

item.title: lebron says winning will take care of his legacy
item.description: lebron james bristled monday at the idea his offensive prowess in the nba finals has been a disappointment and that his unwillingness to take charge down the stretch could ultimately affect his legacy.

item.title: kevin durant and thunder get defensive in road win over heat
item.description: oklahoma city had one of its worst shooting nights of the season. the way the thunder played defense, hardly anyone noticed. except the miami ...

item.title: vaginal gel reduces premature births in some women
item.description: a simple treatment -- a hormone-containing vaginal gel -- significantly reduces premature births among pregnant women who are at high risk ...

item.title: bell, calif. voters recall government officials
item.description: residents of the scandal-riddled city of bell have ousted their entire city government.

item.title: canadian woman found in nevada wilds says she knew end was near
item.description: a canadian woman who survived seven weeks stranded in the nevada wilderness had a premonition her ordeal was ending but did not know if she was about to die or be rescued, her family said on sunday.

item.title: canadian woman found in nevada wilds says she knew end was near
item.description: a canadian woman who survived seven weeks stranded in the nevada wilderness had a premonition her ordeal was ending but did not know if she was about to die or be rescued, her family said on sunday.

item.title: japan carmakers see return to full output taking time
item.description: japanese automakers including toyota motor corp and nissan motor co said on tuesday it would be some time before they could return to full production after japan's devastating march 11 earthquake and tsunami disrupted supplies to their plants.

item.title: north, south sudan to remove abyei forces: u.n.
item.description: north and south sudan have agreed to withdraw all unauthorized forces from the contested abyei border region, the united nations said, in an attempt to defuse tensions in the oil-producing flashpoint.

item.title: california urged to sell its unpaid tax bills
item.description: california should sell its claims to unpaid taxes to the private sector to raise money to bolster its finances, a state tax official said on monday.

item.title: frustrated bulldogs go out with a clang
item.description: if butler's play in the championship game is remembered years from now, it will be for all the wrong reasons.

item.title: parnell to go on disabled list with numbness in finger
item.description: reliever bobby parnell has had numbness in his right middle finger for days and said doctors told him it could be a result of a blood clot.

item.title: 2011 n.c.a.a. tournament | sports of the times: symbolism jumps the years to duke and michigan
item.description: as if it needed a shot of electricity, sunday's duke-michigan game contains an undercurrent of racism and class.

item.title: bruins erupt to blow out rival canadiens, 7-0
item.description: zdeno chara, a bete noire in montreal since the hit that sent max pacioretty to the hospital, had three assists boston bruins turned a grudge match into a blowout.

item.title: in polar bear territory
item.description: scientists counting bowhead whales in arctic alaska have a rare opportunity to observe polar bears in their natural habitat.

item.title: ?visit from goon squad? wins critics award
item.description: jennifer egan won the national book critics circle award on thursday night for her wildly inventive novel of interlocking stories.

item.title: dollar tumbles to 3-year low
item.description: the dollar hit a three-year low against a basket of currencies on thursday as strong corporate earnings buoyed risk appetite in illiquid pre-easter trade, threatening to drive the greenback to historic lows.

item.title: washington: washington: first lady's plane was warned of turbulence
item.description: the air traffic controller who sent a jet carrying michelle obama too close to an air force cargo plane did warn the pilot of the passenger jet to beware of the bigger plane's wake turbulence.

item.title: regret and defense amid tressel fallout
item.description: while ohio state president e. gordon gee admits mistakes in the university's handling of jim tressel's scandal, he says school officials never attempted to skirt n.c.a.a. rules.

item.title: nfl's court-ordered mediation ends without an agreement
item.description: nfl owners and players have wrapped up another round of court-ordered mediation without any sign of a new agreement. officials and attorneys ...

item.title: unclear oversight yields repeated violations at home for troubled youth
item.description: in alameda county, refuge is the sole emergency group-home shelter for emotionally disturbed teenagers, but according to state documents and former employees, it is anything but a safe haven.

item.title: catching scent of revolution, china moves to snip jasmine
item.description: since tunisian revolutionaries anointed their successful revolt the 'jasmine revolution,' the flowering cousin of the olive tree has been branded a nefarious change-agent.

item.title: fears about immigrants deepen divisions in europe
item.description: europe is struggling with how to handle the thousands of new north african immigrants who have entered italy and neighboring countries.

item.title: another bus from new york city's chinatown crashes, two killed
item.description: new jersey state police on tuesday were investigating the deadly crash of another tour bus from new york city's chinatown, which killed the driver and one passenger and injured 41 others.

item.title: twin friars die on same day at age 92
item.description: identical twins julian and adrian riester were born seconds apart. they died hours apart this week.

item.title: a club for the women atop the ladder
item.description: though most members of belizean grove may not be household names, they represent a rare confluence of women's wealth and influence.
